document_title: Heart arrhythmia: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
Arrhythmia is a condition in which the heart rate becomes too fast, too slow, or has a rhythm source other than the sinus node, causing the heart rhythm to become irregular. Another form of arrhythmia is due to damage to the rhythm conduction system in the heart, causing the heart to contract asynchronously, gradually reducing heart function or reducing the patient's ability to function.
See more: Heart arrhythmia in children: Causes, symptoms and treatment
